title: Stories from the League Universe:  The Best of the Best (In My Opinion)
body:
I've decided to make a list of *my* favorite stories from League of Legends, or as the refined people call it, Lag of Legumes.    I've probably read every lore story in the Lag universe, and these are the ones that stuck out to me as exceptional.  This list is completely opinion based, so feel free to pipe in about *your* favorite stories and why you like them!  For now though, let's get on with the list.  I didn't limit myself to some kind of top 10 or anything, but I did order them in least to greatest, so the best are at the bottom.  I hope you like the list!

---

[Scourge of the Desert](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/creative-spotlight/reksai-scourge-desert), featuring a Noxian traveler with mention of Rek'Sai.
*Scourge of the Desert* is told in journal format, and sadly it can't be found on the Universe page (last I checked).  It's about a patriotic Noxian who travels to Shurima, but while there realizes that the world doesn't revolve around Noxus.  I like this story because we don't really get to look into the heads of the commoners visiting a foreign land.  The way his perception of the world changes throughout the story is pretty great.

[The River King](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u9RM4HwwoKs), featuring Tahm Kench and a demon.
This is the only video on the list.  See, Ol' Two-Coats doesn't get a lot of outright lore, but *The River King* tells you everything you need to know about him.  If you really watch the video, you'll realize that there's a lot more depth to Fish-Tank's story than you might have guessed.

[Interrogation 101](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/vi-color-story), featuring Vi.
This short story does a great job of showing Vi personality.  We don't get to see much of her other than "punching solves everything," but *Interrogation 101* shows that, even if she's not too intelligent, she's not a total brute and she can be clever when she wants.

[Nightbloom](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/maokai-color-story), featuring Maokai and a flower.
This story…  oh geez, this story.  It really goes deep into Maokai's personality and motivation, and Maokai has an interesting personality.  *Nightbloom* really shows how far he's willing to go to restore the Blessed Isles to their full glory, and how much he cares about his home.

[Ivory, Ebony, Jasper](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/jarvaniv-color-story/), featuring Jarvan IV and his band of advisors.
This is one of the newer stories from the Demacia lore update.  The thing is, J4's new lore kind of disappointed me.  I mean, it wasn't bad, but his bio put too much emphasis on Shyvana and not enough on him (Shyvana's lore is dope tho).  But when I read this story he was redeemed.  See, you arguably get more information about J4's personality from this very short story than you get from his bio, even when in the story he's mostly emotionless.  In *Ivory, Ebony, Jasper*, J4 is given two options:  Surrender a town to the enemy, effectively abandoning the town's people, or create a risky plan that would save the townspeople.  The way J4 doesn't even give the first option a first thought is wonderful.  It really shows how he views Demacia and its citizens (subjects?).

[A Quick Fix](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/jayce-color-story), featuring Jayce and Sass-Master Amaranthine.
This story is good for reasons similar to what's already been mentioned:  It does a good job of showing the champion's personality.  *A Quick Fix* depicts what it's like for a person who had only heard stories of Jayce's heroism to meet him in real life and see what he really is:  Just some guy who's kind of jerky.  The way they took Jayce's lore was pretty good, and this shows all the ways in which he's different than what we thought he'd be.  Also, shout out to the Sass-Master herself, Amaranthine.  She was a total baller.

[Twin Dawns](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/aurelionsol-color-story/), featuring Aurelion Sol, Pantheon, and a ton of Voidlings.
*Twin Dawns* is a gem because it gives us something we don't usually get:  A look into the mind of a god.  Being the story of a god, it gives us hints and insights into future events that will effect the entire planet, if not universe.  Other than that, I'm a big fan of Void lore, so it's really interesting for me to read about the Void, especially from a source as reputable as a Celestial Dragon.  I also really like the star forging scene.  Like, with any other champion, it would probably be "he conjured a star," but with Sol it goes into how he's manipulating hydrogen to begin the fusion process as he bends gravity, creating nuclear heat so powerful that it's bending the planet's aura permanently.  That creation scene really let's us watch one of the most powerful characters in the game do his work.

[Gift of Venom](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/ivern-color-story/), featuring Ivern, Daisy, Sheldon, Syrus, Mikkus, Risbell, some other guys, aaand… some other guys.
Personally, I think the trope where nature is angry at humans is ridiculously over-used.  So imagine my delight when I read this story.  *Gift of Venom* is so light and whimsical that it's a pleasure to read, and I really do love how it makes sure to say that humans are just as much a part of nature as mewlarks and shagyaks.

[Jhin, the Virtuoso | II-IV](http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/champions/jhin/), featuring Jhin, Shen, Zed, and Akali.
I say II-IV because act one is really just the bio.  This story though.  It's great.  If Sol's story gave us rare insight into the mind of a god, this story gives us rare insight into the mind of a psychopath.  It also let's us see up close an interaction between Shen and Zed, and we don't often see things like that happen in League.  Anyway, Jhin is awesome.  There's not much else to say.

[For Demacia](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/for-demacia/) featuring Lux and Garen (with company).  Oh, and maybe Nocturne.
I like this story because it seems… more real.  It has action, but it also seems like more realistic action.  To me anyway.  I guess what I mean is, it's written less like a short story and more like a chapter in a book, which I think is cool.  Another thing is that a major part of the Demacia lore update was detailing Lux and Garen's relationship.  *For Demacia* is the story where they actually are interacting directly, which is pretty important.  This has been said before, but I'm going to say it again:  The way Garen and Lux's relationship was written was great.  Garen feels love and pride for his sister, but also fears what she might be and what he might have to do to her, so he denies that she might be what she honestly probably is.  Lux loves and respects her brother, but also knows him well enough to fear him if his hand was forced.  The last discussion between the two of them shows this so well.

[Darkness Renews](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/renekton-color-story), featuring Renekton and a guy who whispers.
In my opinion, Renekton is the saddest champion in League.  Even without knowing his entire backstory it's still sad.  He heroically helps seal away a terrible evil at the cost of his own life, but he doesn't die.  No, he's tormented by an enemy that he can't fight for eternity.  He can't die and he can't fight back, he can only sit in darkness while his mind is twisted beyond insanity.  *Darkness Renews* really shows Renekton as something that we don't see in game:  A tired old man who has lost his way completely.  

[Progress Day](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/piltover-progress-day), featuring Tamara and guest starring Caitlyn.
*Progress Day* is kind of like *Code Geass*.  Not in content, but in style.  The story itself is pretty good, but it can start to feel pretty long.  If you read all the way through, however, there's a twist at the end that makes the whole story just fantastic.

[Sai Khaleek](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/reksai-color-story), featuring Jaheje, Shahib, some other guys, and Rek’Sai.
Hey, you've made it to the top three.  Congratulations.  Anyway, let's talk about *Sai Khaleek*.  Around when I first started getting really into the lore, I read Rek'Sai's.  I know that my thought process was something along the lines of "what?  Rek'Sai is just some animal.  A Void animal, granted, but just some animal.  How does she stand a chance against other champions?  She would get slaughtered.  She's just a dumb beast."  I laugh at my younger self often.  How little I knew.  *Sai Khaleek* opened my eyes.  While Rek'Sai is still "just an animal," this story made me realize what she really is:  An apex predator the likes of which Runeterra has never, and *should never have* seen.

[A Good Death](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/good-death), featuring a Magga thing, a lamb, and a wolf.
Just gonna say this now, the link I've given you here is the original link, the one that comes with beautiful art.  It's a shame that that art isn't on the Universe page (I think).  Anyway, *A Good Death* is… well, it's a great story.  It was certainly vying for the top spot.  I really like the Kindred, and I think League's take on death is just epic.  I get chills down my spine whenever I read this thing.

[Lullaby](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/ekko-color-story), featuring Ekko and… some people.
After long thought, I've decided that *Lullaby* is the best story in League.  If you're going to read anything on this list, read *Lullaby*.  It's truly a work of art.  That's all I have to say on the matter.

---

And that's that.  If you found something good to read, please leave an upvote.  And feel free to leave a comment discussing what *your* favorite stories are and why!

Yup, I also like the feels in Matt "FauxSchizzle" Dunn's Lullaby. I'm all about the feels.

While I agree with most of your list, I'd definitely have to put Flesh and Stone at my #1 spot. The way it shows Lux struggling, feeling hated and like she's wrong, only for the symbol of her country to tell her that she's perfect and important struck a chord with me that no other story has.
My favorite is Skarner's story.
Okay, but *why* did you like Skarner's story?  I'm not saying it's a bad story, I just want this to be more of a discussion.  Y'know, go in depth and stuff.

“I must be off now. I promised the tadpoles of Southern Pond that I would monitor their elections for the king of lily pads. It’s quite the contentious race.”

Fuckin' Ivern. I love him so much.
What about {{champion:112}} {{champion:40}} stories?

What about them?  Do you have something to say about them?
######*encouraging you to begin discussion about why you like Viktor and Janna's short stories*

i just happen to really love the stories.
{{champion:112}} finally has a deeper character from it outside being obsessed with his evolution.
{{champion:40}}'s has a weird implication that gods are created from the wishes of man kind (or at least i think so) and gives us a heart warming story about a boy who almost loses hope in life to find out that as long as you keep smiling eventually something good will happen.
Basically these stories add just soo much more dimension to these characters compared to the others IMO

Viktor's story was a nice parallel to Jayce's. A child comes to Jayce expecting a hero, and finds a jerk. Another child comes to Viktor expecting a  monstrous villain, but finds a misunderstood scientist.
Poppy's story (The written one) is amazing. I love how stubborn and selfless they made her, to the point where she doesn't realize she's the Hero she's looking for.

The Weakest Heart (Camille's Short story) is my personal favorite. Really fleshes out how much sacrifice it took to make Camille who she is today, and the responsibility that drives her next steps. It's the little choices like how she doesn't cry but instead burns the papers, and when she lies to the little girl to make her feel better, that make her character shine through.

My favourites are usually big stories, like Burning Tides, Bloodline, Shadow and Fortune, Progress Day (It is good but still feels weak compare to others, possibly because character was not a champion), Flesh and Stone.

If I have to choose between exclusively colour texts, my answer would be I don't know story. There are many good colour texts, I can't decide.

I'm usually bad at choosing my favourites.
You left out [this work of beautiful art](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/janna-color-story/) from Janna's lore update, I'm very disappointed in you.

My favorites are For Demacia, Kalistas story (pre-death) and the Creation of the shadowisles, and how did you not mention it? my favorite is ofc Burning Tides.

Kalistas lore is my number 3. I could imgagine riot writing a novel about her quest to cure the Queen only to come back to the madness that she does. I love it all the way until she awakens as an undead being. I don't really understand her motivations after death. I think riot could make a really good story out of her bio if they detailed it alot more.

Bilgewater Burning Tides, my second favorite story, is a long story with alot of things happening. Often in Leagues lore, nothing is really happening. Riot can not kill a champion because that would just make it feel unsatisfying to play the champion. But Burning Tides pushes the story forward and alot of things Changes. It is exiting and fun to rad through. My final note on it is that MF is such a good character in the lore, especially what we saw from the artbook riot released. Ingame she lacks personality and is just "the sexy pirate".

For demacia, my favorite story is just so good. It made Lux one of my favorite characters in the lore. We got to see her watching as Garen and every other Demacian judged the very thing she is. As they emotionlessly killed an innocent man that was so obviosly possesed by dark magic. But only Lux was not blinded by the Demacian Justice. She could see through it and save everyone. I do not know if the Demacian ideals or if the demon is the villain of the story. I for sure saw Garen as a badguy after this, even though he just want to do things for the better. He would probebly have killed the boy who had dissapeared if he met him. Also in Garens and Luxs last discussion Garen doesn't even care if the "murderer" killed his family because of his own will or if he was inocent. Don't get me wrong I love Garen and Demacias lore as a whole, but it gives me mixed feelings. They are the good, but still the bad. They do not have any mercy. For example when Taric was exiled. They could have had some mercy and made him pay in another way.
 The demon was an awesome villain! I love how they made him and how they don't tell it is Nocturne but hint it so much. I think Nocturne was used to his full potentual. I could not imagine I would like Nocturne as much as I do now. (if it is Nocturne)

burning tides stories not count here?

the graves twisted fate chase imo was incredible plus the reveal of {{champion:4}}  first name

*Burning Tides* overall was great, but it had a few problems on the smaller scale that made me decide not to put it on this list.  Well, to be honest, the only stories on my list that I'm *absolutely sure* should be where they are are the top three.  So who knows, maybe if I re-read *Burning Tides* I'd decide to put it somewhere on the list.
Personally my favorite is one that was retconned. The old Judgemenr with Yorick. Like how J4 gives him a personality, the Judgement gave him life.

I just really like the shurima lore especially nasus, azir, amumu and rammus. The ascended theme is just really intricate and it has so much historical references to the great egypt empires.  I am really fond of the azir and xerath lore because it just shows the character and gameplay so clearly.{{champion:268}} {{champion:268}}  yeah i just love azir{{champion:268}}
Nice!

Huh, surprised there's no Bilgewater. So far I think that's been the best that Riot's written. 

But our tastes are all different of course. I didn't like Twin Dawns at all, and For Demacia I thought was only OK.

Nice list! It's not the same I'd write down, but I liked the short analysis you made of every piece listed :D
